• Grid
  • Backstretch
  • Slider
  • Icons
<div class="column one"></div>
<div class="column two"></div>
<div class="column three"></div>
<div class="column four"></div>
<div class="column five"></div>

Just add the classes you can find above to a block element.
I think they are pretty self explanatory if you want one column add the class one, if you want to columns add the class two etc.
If you want to align block not of the same size you can choose of the following classes:


<div class="column one-five"></div>
<div class="column two-five"></div>
<div class="column three-five"></div>
<div class="column four-five"></div>

<div class="column one-four"></div>
<div class="column three-four"></div>

<div class="column one-three"></div>
<div class="column two-three"></div>
<div class="imageslider">
     <li><img src="images/example.gif" /></li>
     <li><img src="images/example.gif" /></li>
     <li><img src="images/example.gif" /></li>
</div>

This is a basic image slider, all you have to do is put div container or a list element into the div with class="imageslider" and fill it with images.

<div class="contentslider">
     <li><img src="images/user.gif" /></li>
     <p>...</p>
     <h4>Barry Lird</h4>
</div>

This is a basic content slider, all you have to do is put div container or a list element into the div with class="contentslider" and fill it with content.
The slider can display any kind of content, so no worries, just hook it up with something.

HTML:    <section class="row example"> </section>
jQuery:  $(".example").backstretch("images/example.gif");

All you need to do is add a class of your choice for example class="example" to a div container.
Then head to the Javascript section at the bottom and add the jQuery with your selected class and image path!
